BULLETIN NO. 157 
GOVERNANCE COMPLIANCE CHECKLIST 
03/04/2025 
In previous Bulletins, the JIG Governance Processes Committee has informed Members and Users about 
the key Governance Good Practice tools that are made available to members and mandatory for JIG Joint 
Ventures [Links below]: 
-
Core Principles
-
Business Principles
-
Business Risk Assessment
-
Governance and Assurance Manual
Each of the above references require participating Locations to complete an annual review of their 
processes and effective application of the adopted policies. The annual reviews - now called "Annual 
Checklists" - are available for completion in the GOVERNANCE COMPLIANCE section of new Dashboard, 
and this is the requested method for completion. 
On-line completion allows the Location to see a "compliance score", based on the Self-Verification - 
Review - Audit pyramid for assurance, and it also allows JIG Member Area Managers or oversight 
specialists to view the location results online without having to request from each site manager. 
THIS BULLETIN ADVISES ALL LOCATIONS THAT HAVE 
ADOPTED JIG GOVERNANCE GOOD PRACTICES THAT THE 
ANNUAL CHECKLISTS ARE NOW AVAILABLE FOR ONLINE 
COMPLETION IN THE NEW DASHBOARD.

Actions to Implement this Bulletin (See Table below for Action Type Codes)

complete the annual checklist on line every year.

Action Type Codes Table 
Action Types 
JIG Bulletin Action Type Definition 
JS 
Change to JIG Standard - to be adopted by JV and/or Operator to continue to meet the JIG 
Standard(s) (JIG 1, 2, 4, EI/JIG 1530 and the JIG HSSE Management System). 
RA 
Required Action to implement one off verification or checks outlined in the table of actions. 
RP 
JIG Recommended Practice which the JV should consider adopting as its own practice (**). 
I 
Issued for information purposes only. 
Note (**) - If the JV agreements require any of the JIG Standards and/or any of the JIG Common Processes as the 
governing operational standard then adoption of changes to applicable JIG Standards and/or Common Processes 
should not be considered optional by the JV Board.
